metadata.title: CVE-2023-35788 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - high
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in fl_set_geneve_opt in net/sched/cls_flower.c inthe Linux kernel before 6.3.7. It allows an out-of-bounds write in theflower classifier code via TCA_FLOWER_KEY_ENC_OPTS_GENEVE packets. This mayresult in denial of service or privilege escalation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-35788` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.4.0-153-generic - 5.4.0-153.170~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-153-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-153.170~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-153-lowlatency - 5.4.0-153.170~18.04.1

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-16.19').

linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-153.170~18.04.1').
